definition[0]: to obtain money that it has been agreed that you can borrow, or to use money that has been saved
example[0]: He drew down the final $25 million of the loan.
definition[1]: to obtain money as part of a loan that has already been agreed, or to use money that has been saved
example[1]: He drew down the final $25 million of the Bankers Trust loan.
example[2]: A lot of Japanese people will soon reach retirement and begin to draw down their life savings.
definition[2]: to use something that has been reserved or stored
example[3]: Consuming nations should draw down their high oil inventories before asking OPEC to produce more.
